div.a: Read More about MS Locker Cleanout & Tumbler Pickup

span.p: Pledge of Allegiance by Owen Bacon

p.strong: Read this weeks letter for locker and room clean out instructions.

span.p: Schools are a part of many layers of life that are affected by COVID-`19. We have adjusted and everyone in the schools and community has assisted us in meeting the needs of our students. It is a remarkable time of change, flexibility, and many unknowns. We are here to support our kids

I know my world was rocked by Governor DeWine this week. I think most of us expected that school may not return this year. I think what surprised me the most is he told schools to begin looking at options for blended learning in the fall. ARTICLE . I usually try to be an optimist; however, that comment hit me hard. Will we see our kids? Can we ever get back to normal? I know I and our staff cannot wait for their return.

At this juncture no one knows. We just need to try to plan for every scenario. Hopefully, fall of 2020 will bring back learning in school buildings. if that is not possible, the Crestview Local Schools will be ready to deliver the best possible education in any format.

Right now, Dr. Acton and Governor DeWine have relied on sound scientific information to guide us. I know we will attempt to follow their guidelines for the safety of the Rebel nation. Learning and School are so important; however, life is the most important aspect on earth. I and we miss our kids, but our goal is to see them and their families be safe and healthy. We all have many happy memories ahead. Thank you all for working with us through this difficult time and we look forward to singing the Alma Mater together as one Rebel Nation.

p.strong: Receive your diploma in the PAC, Watch Graduation at 2:00 PM on Sunday May 17, 2020. Details Below! All Meeting social distancing guidelines. Celebrate the Class of 2020!

div.a: Crestview High School Senior Art Show 2020

span.span: Some of the senior art students have shared their selections from class this year to bring you our digital version of the Senior Art Show 2020.
Please click the link below to enjoy!

span.p: Do you need to find an email for a staff member? What technology site is she and or he using with their classes. All that information is in the Crestview Remote Learning Playbook. A complete directory for learning and some learning resources.

div.a: Applications for Student Board Member & Superintendent Advisory Due May 4th

span.p: Applications for a new Student Board Member & Superintendent Advisory Due May 4th by Noon. Be a leader and represent the students body at board meetings and at Superintendent Advisory Meetings. how will you serve the community? You are eligible, if you will be a senior for 2020 - 2021. Thls is a resume builder and there is a $500 scholarship for the student school board member. Students need to file an application and will interview with the school board. EMAIL Completed Applications to cschmidt@crestviewlocal.k12.oh.us

p.strong: Food order changes allowed on April 20 & 21, 2020. Changes go into effect on 4-27-2020. Read More in letter.

a.title: Co-ed 7th and 8th Grade Track vs. Columbiana County Meet

div.a: Co-ed 7th and 8th Grade Track vs. Columbiana County Meet

div.p: The Crestview Local Schools do not exclude any persons from participating in classes or programs on the ground of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or handicap. The Crestview Local School hearing officer for compliance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act; Title IX of the Education Amendment of 1972; and section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, is Matthew T Manley Superintendent. To file a complaint phone (330) 482-5526 or write to 44100 Crestview Road, Suite A, Columbiana, Ohio 44408. Crestview Local School District is an equal opportunity employer.
